meanings.definition: A method of fishing using a long line anchored to the bottom with baited hooks at intervals.
meanings.sent1: Fishermen use setlines to catch fish in the deep waters.
meanings.sent2: The setlines were cast into the ocean to lure in the big catch.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat thought the setlines were a fun new toy to play with.
meanings.sent4: The setlines stretched out like spiderwebs in the water, waiting for unsuspecting fish.
meanings.sent5: The glint of the sun on the setlines created a mesmerizing sight for onlookers.

meanings.definition: To establish or arrange something in a particular way.
meanings.sent1: She setlines the books neatly on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: It is important to setlines clear boundaries in any relationship.
meanings.sent3: The magician setlines up his props for the grand performance.
meanings.sent4: Her words setlines a path for success in the project.
meanings.sent5: The artist setlines the colors in a beautiful pattern on the canvas.

meanings.definition: To put something in a specified place or position.
meanings.sent1: He setlines the vase on the table carefully.
meanings.sent2: Please setlines the tools back in their designated spot.
meanings.sent3: The chef setlines the ingredients ready for cooking.
meanings.sent4: She setlines her goals high and works hard to achieve them.
meanings.sent5: The sun setlines behind the mountains, painting the sky in hues of orange and pink.
